text: LayoutParser: A Unified Toolkit for Deep Learning Based Document Image Analysis
Zejiang Shen (), Ruochen Zhang2, Melissa Dell3, Benjamin Charles Germain Lee4, Jacob Carlson3, and Weining Li

1 Allen Institute for AI shannonstallenai.org  Brown University ruochen-zhangebrovn.edu  Harvard University {nelissadell,jacob_carlson}efas.harva 4 University of Washington rd.ed 5 University of Waterloo bcglecs.vashington.edu w422lieuvaterloo.ca

Abstract. Recent advances in document image analysis (DIA) have been primarily driven by the application of neural networks. Ideally, research outcomes could be easily deployed in production and extended for further investigation. However, various factors like loosely organized codebases and sophisticated model configurations complicate the easy reuse of im- portant innovations by a wide audience. Though there have been on-going development in disciplines like natural language processing and computer efforts to improve reusability and simplify deep learning (DL) model This represents a major gap in the existing toolkit, as DIA is central to vision, none of them are optimized for challenges in the domain of DIA and humanities. This paper introduces LayoutParser, an open-source academic research across a wide range of disciplines in the social sciences library for streamlining the usage of DL in DIA research and applica- tions.
